title: BirdyDan here, Permanent Ban appeal.
body:
Hi its BirdyDan here,

So I just got permanently banned. 

It was for one bad mistake which should've never happened If I stuck to my plan.

The Plan: I run an autohotkey script which unbinds my enter key in game which has worked AMAZINGLY over the past 50~ games, even made me climb to D4 MMR. Any Rioter can check my chat history over the past 50 games and you will see that in almost every single one of them there has been virtually 0 chat from me.

Today I forgot to put that on, and in the one game where I get toxic teammates that flame me I retaliated. 

Funny side note, the game I played AFTER the toxic one I had the script turned on and I ended up playing amazingly despite my team still raging at me.

What i'm asking for is a permanent chat ban, not a permanent game ban. I love league and even stream it too! www.twitch.tv/BirdyDan  As a player from preseason 1 who mains Anivia I cant just make another account knowing I had one that I had worked so hard to build up from the beginning.

I'd like to hear your thoughts.

replies.body:
The short of it is, you are being held responsible for your actions. You wouldn't have been perma banned for a first offence, so you've at least seen a 14 day ban in your history. When you received that punishment it would have been made very clear in the reform card that any further violations would result in a permanent suspension of the account.

If you want community feedback on the punishment itself, you can post your logs, but it seems you know what you did constituted an offence, and assuming that in that case the punishment was not falsely applied, it won't be removed under any circumstances. Punishments will only be removed if they are made in error.

You obviously took steps, and that's commendable, but you have to consider the effect your actions have on other players, not just yourself. There comes a point where Riot can no longer encourage reform in players, and simply have to protect those being negatively affected.

I would agree with you, if my ban was because of in-game griefing or things which could not have been avoided with a mute. Majority of my suspensions have been verbal based. I do not believe I am toxic in my playstyle only via communication which I am trying and are improving at.

I do not deserve a permanent ban because of something toxic that can be removed with a chat ban.

End of the day I'm another streamer who was 99.9% non toxic (check vods if you think otherwise.) Who was promoting healthy gameplay who is now going to seek alternatives to pursue for my stream.

I'm happy to compromise but I won't sit here and take a punishment I do not think is valid.

Should we be expected to mute everyone from the start of the game? If you have to mute someone, generally the damage is already done. Personally if someone is being a little salty I'm not gonna mute them unless it's bothering me. If I have to make the decision to mute it's because someone has taken things way too far and there's no point communicating with them anymore. At the point I have to mute someone, I'm going to report them.

All that aside, why does it fall on *other* players to be responsible for *your* behaviour. You are being held responsible. From the sounds of things you have received all three previous punishment tiers (2 chat restrictions and a 14 day ban). You say you deserved those because you made no effort to reform and therefore continued through the tiers. You made attempts at reform *only* once you realised your account was in serious danger of being permabanned. 

Clearly you were made very aware that one slip-up would cost you your account, and even knowing that you could not control your temper to save something you supposedly care so much about. You have essentially proven to Riot, to the punishment systems and to the other players that you don't care about how you might be ruining the experience for others, only that yours has been ruined, and that's a little hypocritical don't you think?

You proved that chat restrictions weren't enough to prompt you to reflect, and the temporary ban only worked in a temporary effect. If even self preservation, with only you standing to lose something, still could not prevent you from engaging in abusive behaviour, what do you expect Riot to do exactly?

And yet, that is pretty much the same situation as has occurred here, yet you adamantly claim that you don't deserve *this* punishment. You did *nothing* to "fix" your problem in this case, all you did was prevent the symptoms from appearing. The problem is still there, as clear as ever, as evidence by the fact that you chose to retaliate against flamers (resulting in the ban).

As Lakigr and Seras have said, this is an issue where *you* lack the self control to control your own behaviours. That is not Riot's fault, that is not the fault of other players, that is *your* fault (and, dare I say, the fault of your parents for not teaching you basic self control). If you want to prevent this same kind of thing happening in the future (with any situation, not just LoL) then it is up to ***you*** to fix the problem, not the symptoms.

You make it sound like I was flaming people left right and centre and every single game consisted of me going off my head. 

No actually I've played WELL over 4000 games in my career and if you're going to judge me base off the 0.001% of games I am toxic in and not the 99.9% of the ones where I have a good game then I don't know what to say. 

And if you want an ananolgy to compare and since Lakigr loves cars so much, this is like me caught speeding 10km/h over the limit one too many times over the course of 4 years. Do I deserve punishment? Yes do I deserve life in prison? No.
Only take 1 crime to go to jail.

Chat logs please! 
Must have been some pretty toxic stuff! 
Entertain me!
